document.title: WI Standards  for Information and Technology Literacy (ITL) 2017

BA7F06755AF848278B5E2C83A0BFD2EE.description:
Explore and analyze local
and global issues and
leverage collaborative
digital tools to work with
others to investigate,
develop, and actualize
solutions.

F4913E51C15C49379C9C7BABB7DF71CF.description:
Explore
local and global
issues and use
collaborative
digital resources
to investigate
and develop
solutions.

9425AD18B38F424DA873DC86450AFFA8.description:
Leverage collaborative
digital tools to work with
others—including peers,
experts, and community
members—to learn about
issues and problems and to
solicit diverse local and
global perspectives to
discuss solutions for social
change.

6488E9414A634D14B9BEDB54509D8A72.description:
Use
collaborative
digital resources
to examine
issues and
problems from
diverse local and
global
perspectives.

BE7A336498CB4ABFB8769E4E415C510E.description:
Global Collaborator (GC) 2: Students use digital tools to connect with a global network of learners and engage with issues that
impact local and global communities.

45C3039348164135814C443038EE3CE2.description:
Select and leverage
appropriate digital tools to
contribute to and collect
information from the
exchange of ideas within
and beyond the learning
community.

1FA0C98FE8F0431D95B03C4E77A5D00C.description:
Contribute to
the exchange of
ideas within and
beyond the
learning
community.

A221C8AD848D4C0D88D416686FB2AA76.description:
Contribute constructively
to project teams, assuming
various roles and
responsibilities to work
effectively toward a
common goal.

7CC731AA31F84EAAAAB758DDADC8F302.description:
Use digital tools to connect
with learners from a variety
of backgrounds and
cultures, engaging with
them in ways that broaden
mutual understanding and
learning.

D6059EC2AD8049DCBD252E78B5075808.description:
Use
digital tools to
connect with
learners from a
variety of
backgrounds and
cultures

50D79171EDDC41FCBCD7E8D03A3D63B5.description:
Global Collaborator (GC)1: Students use digital tools to broaden their perspectives and enrich their learning with culturally
responsive practices by collaborating and working effectively with local and global teams.

45FD5DE80A7D4A0C8A8147EDECD13199.description:
Intentionally align message
with audience, purpose, and
task when publishing and
presenting content.

B132D06515A946DCB85C35747EB831AF.description: Creative Communicator (CC) 2: Students publish and present content customized for their audience(s), purpose, and task.

25B96F3474DD407F96B4BC94439206CD.description:
Utilize digital tools to
analyze, modify, and
communicate complex
ideas, data, and solutions to
an authentic audience.

6565AF88DCB0446DA1B6F7F176C7CE4E.description:
Communicate
effectively using
a variety of
digital tools

18EA7F76D7914208B47807BEDA34AFAE.description:
Create works for an
authentic audience that
reflect responsible remixing
of digital and Fair Use
content.

37764FBFA00A4B0AB87FA65FF2F7DEC1.description:
Evaluate and determine
appropriate platforms and
digital tools to create,
communicate, and share
content effectively with an
authentic audience.

1F79984E998040B09E9F704D54E446C3.description:
Choose
appropriate
platforms and
digital tools.

E8D9F02F29D24D87B6DCBD7C6049893B.description:
Creative Communicator (CC) 1: Students communicate clearly and express themselves creatively for a variety of purposes using the
platforms, tools, styles, formats, and digital media appropriate to their goals.

36A1EF5A16D342B088ED87730E2C500F.description:
Evaluate the problemsolving process and
algorithms of others, and
synthesize this information
to create the most effective
and efficient way to solve
an authentic problem.

6E64BB9EF55C4F22A3EC6BF72B02B7F1.description:
Break problems
into smaller
parts, identify
key information,
and develop
descriptive
models.

D6C787AFD94142DFA5034C4E24F27B18.description:
Select an effective digital
tool to collect data, design,
code, test, and verify
possible solutions to reflect
on the data to solve
authentic problems.

AF2A5307D422428DA6614C798AC1338E.description:
Collect data,
then identify and
use digital tools
to analyze and
represent the
data to find
solutions.

136CBB222BF341B8929140A0C07DB715.description:
Create and articulate a
precise and thorough
description of a problem
designed to utilize digital
tools, data analysis, abstract
modeling, or algorithmic
thinking to facilitate a
solution.

0DEA8E75E6CB4FF49F94F2B8390C0B36.description:
Identify, define,
and interpret
problems where
digital tools can
assist in finding
solutions.

28868F43A9604BFFB9521E29BC71FDEF.description: Computational Thinker (CT) 1: Students develop and employ strategies for understanding and solving problems.

0E4936C2A7BD44028106152C0D34F7D4.description:
Engage in an iterative
process to develop and test
prototypes. Apply this
process to marketplaces,
determine the metrics for
success and progress
monitoring, and understand
that no product is final or
perfect.

6767D16EAE2543C9B3FC847AFFBFB720.description:
Develop,
test, and refine
prototypes as
part of a cyclical
design process.

4B4CF196188F4D29B71A711029E26025.description:
Select and use digital
resources to plan and
manage a design process
that considers design
constraints and calculated
risks as they apply to
authentic problems.

013956D7464446A78F3012416487F9A6.description:
Select and
use digital
resources to plan
and manage a
design process
that considers
design
constraints and
calculated risks.

0FC0DF833BE44734B9E57AF48A17E085.description:
Select and use a deliberate
design process for
generating ideas, testing
theories, and creating
innovative artifacts.

E0F7D69E306C4B1CB052D4716DA6EEDB.description:
Know and
use a deliberate
design process
for generating
ideas, testing
theories, and
creating
innovative
artifacts and solutions.

8AF45A66C0DB40E8AA88499F9FD546FF.description:
Innovative Designer (ID) 2: Students use a variety of technologies within a design process to create new, useful, and imaginative
solutions.

5864A4DD650E4768831CF3E8EBFAC15E.description:
Apply abstract concepts to
solve authentic, open ended problems for a group
of stakeholders.

19886BF88CB4475BA893BF4909013785.description:
Exhibit
tolerance for
ambiguity,
perseverance,
and the capacity
to work with
authentic, open ended problems.

354A25F4FAC946D5A996B9427C7D4B84.description:
Collaboratively analyze the
community locally and
globally to make change
socially. Explain the depth
and breadth of a problem
and analyze conditions for
improvement.

4E5D72188F124224A624344DCD9BDCC2.description:
Find
authentic
problems in local
and global
contexts.

53438615043D44B5AFE4091814D21F5E.description:
Innovative Designer (ID) 1: Students use a variety of digital tools and resources to identify and solve authentic problems using design
thinking.

63F10C34F39244B6BE7B309F143B11DF.description:
Build knowledge by actively
exploring real-world issues
and problems,
independently developing
ideas and theories and
pursuing answers and
solutions

7DE5CDEABB074620A84D04A94A28345F.description:
Use knowledge,
information skills, and
digital resources and tools
to engage in public
conversation and debate
around issues of common
concern.

B6841AF4E64941AFBF41CB51141314F7.description:
Build
knowledge by
actively
exploring real world issues and
problems.

697A53FC888449D2BC1F3768CFFAF65F.description:
Explore, select, and utilize
multiple sources of curated
information to produce
creative artifacts for
multiple audiences,
demonstrating meaningful
connections or conclusions
and consider the value of
crowdsourcing, and how it
works both online and
offline.

133555EAD7BA47CA9306144672B285F9.description:
Knowledge Constructor (KC) 2: Students produce creative artifacts and make meaningful learning experiences from curated knowledge
for themselves and others.

4D0BA6A9687E495C957330238C85C5C3.description:
Locate, collect, and evaluate
resources and curated
collections from a variety of
sources and organize
content into themes in ways
that are coherent and
shareable to multiple
audiences.

A677B007917F42FF9A8F6C53139731D0.description:
Select information that is
related to a problem or
question while using
formats and genre most
appropriate to the content.
Establish criteria in judging
the information in this
process.

53BB19185F404AA0A3932D22983D6C0A.description:
Assess the quality of
evidence and data found in
selected sources on basis of
accuracy, validity,
appropriateness for needs,
importance, and social and
cultural context. Evaluate
information and graphics
for prejudice, false data,
misrepresentation, and
misleading data

42FDD2F794E34241B4AF273A456FE8DD.description:
Evaluate
the accuracy,
perspective,
credibility, and
relevance of
information,
media, data or
other resources.

E63F30573A0B4B0E9D81E8ABFDD7CB7E.description:
Utilize an inquiry-based
process to deepen content
knowledge, connect
academic learning with the
real world, pursue personal
interests, and investigate
opportunities for personal
growth.

A398643AF05240FCB6A87673284CD389.description:
Plan and employ effective
research strategies to
locate and access
information and other
resources for intellectual or
creative pursuits.

DAD4FF969AAA4979B061ABF1FA6B5ECF.description:
Apply safe and effective
search strategies across a
range of diverse resources.

73F43B3C74584B138044C5B63DFE1633.description:
Plan and
employ effective
research
strategies.

FBF5076C0313444F83CA583F1B808B88.description: Knowledge Constructor (KC)1: Students critically curate a variety of digital tools and diverse resources.

3FFDA11E50EC413691879233FB8D99C5.description:
Recognize free speech,
along with constitutional
exceptions on free speech,
and its impact on
individuals, groups, and
communities, both online
and offline.

4DE3EE4E2EE14F5C96BDB883FFED4BFA.description:
Demonstrate positive and
responsible
communications in digital
communities

FDE6E39E80B948F98C176AC14E91672E.description:
Understand the importance
of equitable access to
information and
recommend strategies for
ensuring others have
equitable access to
information, media,
resources, and technology.

6CA3F692AFE345298CF50A5D5362395B.description:
Recognize the
rights and
responsibilities
of intellectual
freedom in a
democratic
society.

1DA41741F8764E92A2E82F06A7ED684F.description:
Describe how to
correspond with authors,
publishers, or producers to
obtain permission to use
copyrighted materials while
understanding legal
consequences of plagiarism.

9623B11272E748C98FB0E16CCBB0F018.description:
Assess the need for
different information
policies and user
agreements in a variety of
settings (i.e. workplace,
school, government).

A44A62C70E594E10873908ABDB6454F9.description:
Use
information,
media, and
digital resources
in a responsible
manner.

0E70C31DB6734DC997559DCE2572598E.description:
Digital Citizen (DC) 2: Students will demonstrate an understanding of and respect for the rights and obligations of using and
sharing intellectual property.

B2507C0EFA414E5283A017799BA93EB6.description:
Develop strategies to guard
against malicious threats
including viruses, phishing,
and identity theft, and
recognize the importance of
security protocols.

EA954B48062C4B9BBBFEB4F443736536.description:
Identify situations where
data-collection technology
is used to track navigation
online and decide when it is
or is not appropriate.

9ADDA316C9F04760BC8141460BEEBF12.description:
Utilize secure password
protection practices and
management.

93005A6611B44C57A56E0399ADCC6DC5.description:
Manage
personal data to
maintain digital
privacy and
security

F412A9689AE342CCB1EF331A0DEAD2DA.description:
Analyze broader norms and
media messages that may
frame the way people use,
interpret, and respond to
photos on social network
sites and discuss the
influence on society.

8AC41E1CC56F4014A4FC974B683105B6.description:
Choose information to post
online that positively
affects personal image and
future college and career
opportunities.

2F500690B92F4BD69DF72DF094BDD392.description:
Manage digital identity and
practice positive online
responsibilities to avoid
inappropriate forms of self disclosure.

0FDDFE1604554F79BE8342DA38B6FA98.description:
Cultivate
and manage
digital identity
and reputation.

75CE16C053AD445E8F35B0955D4C5D6D.description:
Digital Citizen (DC) 1: Students recognize the rights, responsibilities, and opportunities of living, learning, and working in an
interconnected digital world.

245E6606C047443E8830C231F6DAE975.description:
Investigate the creation of
new technologies

EB50C9DD16D5441FBC4AA8852DB74C14.description: Empowered Learner (EL) 3: Students are able to transfer knowledge to explore emerging technologies.

818485D390D643339D1876D1315D5550.description:
Assess the fundamental
concepts of digital tool
operations; demonstrate
the ability to choose, use,
and troubleshoot current
digital tools.

C299029A21B04C728DEDA3611D8E0DFE.description:
Understand and
apply functions
and operations.

7E40A0031E564133AFBD12CF8E742104.description:
Empowered Learner (EL) 2: Students understand the fundamental concepts of technology operations and demonstrate the ability to
choose, use, and troubleshoot current technologies.

13DB5A9A15D74B8FB2E2B10B8CCF1F04.description:
Evaluate and utilize digital
tools to seek feedback from
digital and nondigital, then
analyze data to make
adjustments and justify
outcomes.

44B0101508F744FDAD872A3BF0E65EC7.description:
Prioritize digital tools to
customize personalized
learning environments in
ways that maximize the
learning process.

AA1152C3EAF74B3994FD135FEE786745.description:
Build a professional online
presence to connect with
experts and peers to
enhance learning processes
and outcomes and prepare
for future endeavors.

D23B9DFB064E4BDA9996E430FB87C7D0.description:
Utilize digital tools to
reflect on the learning
process, including
successes, areas of
improvement, and then
make necessary revisions
and adjust goals for future
learning.

361296D2D5204ECBA92C47C0D5A13CDA.description:
Create and articulate
personal learning goals and
develop strategies
leveraging the most
effective digital tools to
achieve those goals.

EB6A65B3BE474AEDB1A72ABD97F3D7AB.description:
Empowered Learner (EL): Students leverage digital tools and strategies to take an active role in choosing and achieving their
learning goals
